segment.source: Monitoring Application Virtualization Servers
segment.target: Monitoring Application Virtualization Servers

segment.source: Monitoring Application Virtualization Servers
segment.target: Monitoring Application Virtualization Servers

segment.source: Monitoring Application Virtualization Servers
segment.target: Monitoring Application Virtualization Servers

segment.source: To simplify Application Virtualization (App-V) Server management, you can use the System Center Operations Manager 2007 Management Pack.
segment.target: To simplify Application Virtualization (App-V) Server management, you can use the System Center Operations Manager 2007 Management Pack.

segment.source: This Management Pack supports only Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 servers; it does not support previous server versions.
segment.target: This Management Pack supports only Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 servers; it does not support previous server versions.

segment.source: The Management Pack maximizes App-V Server availability for handling App-V Client requests.
segment.target: The Management Pack maximizes App-V Server availability for handling App-V Client requests.

segment.source: Status Indicators
segment.target: Status Indicators

segment.source: The App-V Server health status indicators are color-coded.
segment.target: The App-V Server health status indicators are color-coded.

segment.source: The colors represent the following status values:
segment.target: The colors represent the following status values:

segment.source: No color indicates that the server is running without non-recoverable errors.
segment.target: No color indicates that the server is running without non-recoverable errors.

segment.source: Yellow indicates that one of the components is not functioning correctly.
segment.target: Yellow indicates that one of the components is not functioning correctly.

segment.source: The overall functionality of the server is degraded, but the server is still available.
segment.target: The overall functionality of the server is degraded, but the server is still available.

segment.source: Red indicates that the server is not available and that it cannot provide key services or communicate with external service dependencies.
segment.target: Red indicates that the server is not available and that it cannot provide key services or communicate with external service dependencies.

segment.source: Monitoring Criteria
segment.target: Monitoring Criteria

segment.source: The Management Pack monitors the following aspects of server health:
segment.target: The Management Pack monitors the following aspects of server health:

segment.source: Server Status—monitors server events to validate that the server is providing its expected services.
segment.target: Server Status—monitors server events to validate that the server is providing its expected services.

segment.source: Data Store Access—tracks the ability of one or more of the App-V Management Servers to access and communicate with the App-V data store.
segment.target: Data Store Access—tracks the ability of one or more of the App-V Management Servers to access and communicate with the App-V data store.

segment.source: Content Data Access—monitors access to the Content directory, which might be a local directory or a network share, and the ability to read the requested files.
segment.target: Content Data Access—monitors access to the Content directory, which might be a local directory or a network share, and the ability to read the requested files.

segment.source: Security—reports errors with the App-V Server’s certificate and secure communications.
segment.target: Security—reports errors with the App-V Server’s certificate and secure communications.

segment.source: Client Request Handling—monitors the ability of one or more of the App-V Servers to handle and correctly respond to client requests.
segment.target: Client Request Handling—monitors the ability of one or more of the App-V Servers to handle and correctly respond to client requests.

segment.source: These requests include publishing such items as configuration requests, package load requests, and out of sequence requests.
segment.target: These requests include publishing such items as configuration requests, package load requests, and out of sequence requests.

segment.source: Server Configuration—checks the configuration settings of the App-V Server.
segment.target: Server Configuration—checks the configuration settings of the App-V Server.

segment.source: These configuration settings include the settings in the registry and in the App-V data store.
segment.target: These configuration settings include the settings in the registry and in the App-V data store.

segment.source: Server Differences
segment.target: Server Differences

segment.source: The main differences between the App-V Management Server and the App-V Streaming Server are as follows:
segment.target: The main differences between the App-V Management Server and the App-V Streaming Server are as follows:

segment.source: App-V Management Servers can provide publishing, streaming, management, and reporting services.
segment.target: App-V Management Servers can provide publishing, streaming, management, and reporting services.

segment.source: Therefore, the Management Pack can manage more aspects of the App-V Management Server than it can manage on the App-V Streaming Server, which provides only package streaming.
segment.target: Therefore, the Management Pack can manage more aspects of the App-V Management Server than it can manage on the App-V Streaming Server, which provides only package streaming.

segment.source: The App-V Streaming Server does not have an App-V data store, so data store access is not monitored.
segment.target: The App-V Streaming Server does not have an App-V data store, so data store access is not monitored.

segment.source: The configuration information for the App-V Streaming Server is managed in the registry.
segment.target: The configuration information for the App-V Streaming Server is managed in the registry.

segment.source: The App-V Streaming Server does not use the App-V Server Management Console interface; use other tools to manage the configuration.
segment.target: The App-V Streaming Server does not use the App-V Server Management Console interface; use other tools to manage the configuration.
